en.purpose: To calculate FISI score and its interpretation.
en.use:
Variables:
1. Incontinent to gas
- Never (0 points)
- 1 to 3 times per month (4 points)
- 1 time per week (6 points)
- 2 or more times per week (8 points)
- 1 time per day (11 points)
- 2 or more times per day (12 points)
2. Incontinent for mucus
- Never (0 points)
- 1 to 3 times per month (3 points)
- 1 time per week (5 points)
- 2 or more times per week (7 points)
- 1 time per day (10 points)
- 2 or more times per day (12 points)
3. Incontinent for liquid stool
- Never (0 points)
- 1 to 3 times per month (8 points)
- 1 time per week (10 points)
- 2 or more times per week (13 points)
- 1 time per day (17 points)
- 2 or more times per day (19 points)
4. Incontinent for solid stool
- Never (0 points)
- 1 to 3 times per month (8 points)
- 1 time per week (10 points)
- 2 or more times per week (13 points)
- 1 time per day (16 points)
- 2 or more times per day (18 points)
Formula: The sum of the ordinal scores.
Interpretation: 
The original study by Rockwood et al. does not provide a specific cut off and the rule of thumb is the one introduced above. Patients who score closer to 61 are likely to have their quality of life severely impacted by the fecal incontinence they suffer from. A subsequent study by Cavanaugh et al. found that FISI scores above 30 are more likely to be associated with an impaired quality of life than scores of 30 and below.
